mn148:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
mn148:1.3: There the Buddha addressed the monks,
mn148:2.1: “Monks, I shall teach you the Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased. And I shall reveal a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure, namely,
mn148:2.3: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
mn148:3.1: “The six interior sense fields should be understood. The six exterior sense fields should be understood. The six classes of consciousness should be understood. The six classes of contact should be understood. The six classes of feeling should be understood. The six classes of craving should be understood.
mn148:4.1: ‘The six interior sense fields should be understood.’
mn148:4.2: That’s what I said, but why did I say it?
mn148:4.3: There are the sense fields of the seer, hearer, smeller, taster, toucher, and thinker.
mn148:4.4: ‘The six interior sense fields should be understood.’
mn148:4.5: That’s what I said, and this is why I said it.
mn148:4.6: This is the first set of six.
mn148:5.1: ‘The six exterior sense fields should be understood.’
mn148:5.2: That’s what I said, but why did I say it?
mn148:5.3: There are the sense fields of the seen, heard, smelled, tasted, touched, and thought.
mn148:5.4: ‘The six exterior sense fields should be understood.’
mn148:5.5: That’s what I said, and this is why I said it.
mn148:5.6: This is the second set of six.
mn148:6.1: ‘The six classes of consciousness should be understood.’
mn148:6.2: That’s what I said, but why did I say it?
mn148:6.3: Eye consciousness arises dependent on the seer and the seen.
mn148:6.4: Ear consciousness arises dependent on the hearer and the heard.
mn148:6.5: Nose consciousness arises dependent on the smeller and the smelled.
mn148:6.6: Tongue consciousness arises dependent on the taster and the tasted.
mn148:6.7: Body consciousness arises dependent on the toucher and the touched.
mn148:6.8: Mind consciousness arises dependent on the thinker and thoughts.
mn148:6.9: ‘The six classes of consciousness should be understood.’
mn148:6.10: That’s what I said, and this is why I said it.
mn148:6.11: This is the third set of six.
mn148:7.1: ‘The six classes of contact should be understood.’
mn148:7.2: That’s what I said, but why did I say it?
mn148:7.3: Eye consciousness arises dependent on the seer and the seen. The meeting of the three is contact.
mn148:7.4: Ear consciousness arises dependent on the hearer and the heard. The meeting of the three is contact.
mn148:7.5: Nose consciousness arises dependent on the smeller and the smelled. The meeting of the three is contact.
mn148:7.6: Tongue consciousness arises dependent on the taster and the tasted. The meeting of the three is contact.
mn148:7.7: Body consciousness arises dependent on the toucher and the touched. The meeting of the three is contact.
mn148:7.8: Mind consciousness arises dependent on the thinker and thoughts. The meeting of the three is contact.
mn148:7.9: ‘The six classes of contact should be understood.’
mn148:7.10: That’s what I said, and this is why I said it.
mn148:7.11: This is the fourth set of six.
mn148:8.1: ‘The six classes of feeling should be understood.’
mn148:8.2: That’s what I said, but why did I say it?
mn148:8.3: Eye consciousness arises dependent on the seer and the seen. The meeting of the three is contact. Contact is a condition for feeling.
mn148:8.4: Ear consciousness arises dependent on the hearer and the heard. The meeting of the three is contact. Contact is a condition for feeling.
mn148:8.5: Nose consciousness arises dependent on the smeller and the smelled. The meeting of the three is contact. Contact is a condition for feeling.
mn148:8.6: Tongue consciousness arises dependent on the taster and the tasted. The meeting of the three is contact. Contact is a condition for feeling.
mn148:8.7: Body consciousness arises dependent on the toucher and the touched. The meeting of the three is contact. Contact is a condition for feeling.
mn148:8.8: Mind consciousness arises dependent on the thinker and the thought. The meeting of the three is contact. Contact is a condition for feeling.
mn148:8.9: ‘The six classes of feeling should be understood.’
mn148:8.10: That’s what I said, and this is why I said it.
mn148:8.11: This is the fifth set of six.
mn148:9.1: ‘The six classes of craving should be understood.’
mn148:9.2: That’s what I said, but why did I say it?
mn148:9.3: Eye consciousness arises dependent on the seer and the seen. The meeting of the three is contact. Contact is a condition for feeling. Feeling is a condition for craving.
mn148:9.8: Mind consciousness arises dependent on the thinker and the thought. The meeting of the three is contact. Contact is a condition for feeling. Feeling is a condition for craving.
mn148:9.9: ‘The six classes of craving should be understood.’
mn148:9.10: That’s what I said, and this is why I said it.
mn148:9.11: This is the sixth set of six.
mn148:10.1: If anyone says, ‘the seer is self,’ that is not tenable.
mn148:10.2: The arising and vanishing of the seer is evident,
mn148:10.3: so it would follow that one’s self arises and vanishes.
mn148:10.4: That’s why it’s not tenable to claim that
mn148:10.6: So the seer is not self.
mn148:10.7: If anyone says, ‘the seen are self,’ that is not tenable.
mn148:10.8: The arising and vanishing of the seen is evident,
mn148:10.9: so it would follow that one’s self arises and vanishes.
mn148:10.10: That’s why it’s not tenable to claim that
mn148:10.12: So the seer is not self and sights are not self.
mn148:10.13: If anyone says, ‘eye consciousness is self,’ that is not tenable.
mn148:10.14: The arising and vanishing of eye consciousness is evident,
mn148:10.15: so it would follow that one’s self arises and vanishes.
mn148:10.16: That’s why it’s not tenable to claim that
mn148:10.18: So the seer, the seen, and eye consciousness are not self.
mn148:10.19: If anyone says, ‘eye contact is self,’ that is not tenable.
mn148:10.20: The arising and vanishing of eye contact is evident,
mn148:10.21: so it would follow that one’s self arises and vanishes.
mn148:10.22: That’s why it’s not tenable to claim that
mn148:10.24: So the seer, the seen, eye consciousness, and eye contact are not self.
mn148:10.25: If anyone says, ‘feeling is self,’ that is not tenable.
mn148:10.26: The arising and vanishing of feeling is evident,
mn148:10.27: so it would follow that one’s self arises and vanishes.
mn148:10.28: That’s why it’s not tenable to claim that
mn148:10.30: So the seer, the seen, eye consciousness, eye contact, and feeling are not self.
mn148:10.31: If anyone says, ‘craving is self,’ that is not tenable.
mn148:10.32: The arising and vanishing of craving is evident,
mn148:10.33: so it would follow that one’s self arises and vanishes.
mn148:10.34: That’s why it’s not tenable to claim that
mn148:10.36: So the seer, the seen, eye consciousness, eye contact, feeling, and craving are not self.
mn148:11.1: If anyone says, ‘the hearer is self’ …
mn148:11.5: ‘the thinker is self,’ that is not tenable.
mn148:11.6: The arising and vanishing of the thinker is evident,
mn148:11.7: so it would follow that one’s self arises and vanishes.
mn148:11.8: That’s why it’s not tenable to claim that
mn148:11.10: So the thinker is not self.
mn148:15.7: ‘craving is self,’ that is not tenable.
mn148:15.8: The arising and vanishing of craving is evident,
mn148:15.9: so it would follow that one’s self arises and vanishes.
mn148:15.10: That’s why it’s not tenable to claim that
mn148:15.12: So the thinker, thoughts, mind consciousness, mind contact, feeling, and craving are not self.
mn148:16.1: Now, monks, this is the way that leads to the origin of identity.
mn148:16.2: You regard the seer like this: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self.’
mn148:17-21.5: craving like this: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self.’
mn148:17-21.10: thinker … thoughts … mind consciousness … mind contact … feeling … craving like this: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self.’
mn148:22.1: But this is the way that leads to the cessation of identity.
mn148:22.2: You regard the seer like this: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’
mn148:23-27.5: craving like this: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’
mn148:23-27.10: thinker like this: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’
mn148:23-27.15: craving like this: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’
mn148:28.1: Eye consciousness arises dependent on the the seer and the seen. The meeting of the three is contact. Contact is a condition for the arising of what is felt as pleasant, painful, or neutral.
mn148:28.2: When you experience a pleasant feeling, if you approve, welcome, and keep clinging to it,
mn148:28.3: the underlying tendency to greed underlies that.
mn148:28.4: When you experience a painful feeling, if you sorrow and wail and lament, beating your breast and falling into confusion,
mn148:28.5: the underlying tendency to repulsion underlies that.
mn148:28.6: When you experience a neutral feeling, if you don’t truly understand that feeling’s origin, ending, gratification, drawback, and escape,
mn148:28.7: the underlying tendency to ignorance underlies that.
mn148:28.8: Monks, without giving up the underlying tendency to greed for pleasant feeling, without dispelling the underlying tendency to repulsion towards painful feeling, without eradicating ignorance in the case of neutral feeling, without giving up ignorance and without giving rise to knowledge, it’s simply impossible to make an end of suffering in the present life.
mn148:29-33.5: Mind consciousness arises dependent on the thinker and thoughts. The meeting of the three is contact. Contact is a condition for the arising of what is felt as pleasant, painful, or neutral.
mn148:29-33.6: When you experience a pleasant feeling, if you approve, welcome, and keep clinging to it,
mn148:29-33.7: the underlying tendency to greed underlies that.
mn148:29-33.8: When you experience a painful feeling, if you sorrow and wail and lament, beating your breast and falling into confusion,
mn148:29-33.9: the underlying tendency to repulsion underlies that.
mn148:29-33.10: When you experience a neutral feeling, if you don’t truly understand that feeling’s origin, ending, gratification, drawback, and escape,
mn148:29-33.11: the underlying tendency to ignorance underlies that.
mn148:29-33.12: Monks, without giving up the underlying tendency to greed for pleasant feeling, without dispelling the underlying tendency to repulsion towards painful feeling, without eradicating ignorance in the case of neutral feeling, without giving up ignorance and without giving rise to knowledge, it’s simply impossible to make an end of suffering in the present life.
mn148:34.1: Eye consciousness arises dependent on the seer and the seen. The meeting of the three is contact. Contact is a condition for the arising of what is felt as pleasant, painful, or neutral.
mn148:34.2: When you experience a pleasant feeling, if you don’t approve, welcome, and keep clinging to it,
mn148:34.3: the underlying tendency to greed does not underlie that.
mn148:34.4: When you experience a painful feeling, if you don’t sorrow or wail or lament, beating your breast and falling into confusion,
mn148:34.5: the underlying tendency to repulsion does not underlie that.
mn148:34.6: When you experience a neutral feeling, if you truly understand that feeling’s origin, ending, gratification, drawback, and escape,
mn148:34.7: the underlying tendency to ignorance does not underlie that.
mn148:34.8: Monks, after giving up the underlying tendency to greed for pleasant feeling, after dispelling the underlying tendency to repulsion towards painful feeling, after eradicating ignorance in the case of neutral feeling, after giving up ignorance and giving rise to knowledge, it’s totally possible to make an end of suffering in the present life.
mn148:39.1: Mind consciousness arises dependent on the thinker and thoughts. The meeting of the three is contact. Contact is a condition for what is felt as pleasant, painful, or neutral.
mn148:39.2: When you experience a pleasant feeling, if you don’t approve, welcome, and keep clinging to it,
mn148:39.3: the underlying tendency to greed does not underlie that.
mn148:39.4: When you experience a painful feeling, if you don’t sorrow or wail or lament, beating your breast and falling into confusion,
mn148:39.5: the underlying tendency to repulsion does not underlie that.
mn148:39.6: When you experience a neutral feeling, if you truly understand that feeling’s origin, ending, gratification, drawback, and escape,
mn148:39.7: the underlying tendency to ignorance does not underlie that.
mn148:39.8: Monks, after giving up the underlying tendency to greed for pleasant feeling, after dispelling the underlying tendency to repulsion towards painful feeling, after eradicating ignorance in the case of neutral feeling, after giving up ignorance and giving rise to knowledge, it’s totally possible to make an end of suffering in the present life.
mn148:40.1: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with the seer, the seen, eye consciousness, eye contact, feeling, and craving.
mn148:41.1: They grow disillusioned with the hearer …
mn148:41.5: thinker, thoughts, mind consciousness, mind contact, feeling, and craving.
mn148:41.6: Being disillusioned, desire fades away. When desire fades away they’re freed. When it is freed, they know it is freed.
mn148:41.7: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’”
mn148:41.8: That is what the Buddha said.
mn148:41.9: Satisfied, the monks were happy with what the Buddha said.
mn148:41.10: And while this discourse was being spoken, the minds of sixty monks were freed from defilements by not grasping.
